normalized: the satellite city of cordelia was, as suggested by the word “satellite”, a spheroid space colony.
an artificial living environment had been reproduced in a spherical shape by means of the latest in terraforming.
unlike the earth, the interior of the colony had been divided in accordance with a detailed development plan.
this included blocks for residential use, industry and agriculture, and they had even created an artificial ocean area for recreation.
on the one hand, the residential space was basically overflowing with greenery, and on the other, skyscrapers over 50 storeys and 300 m tall were neatly lined up together.
one could say that its manufactured beauty was not limited to cordelia, but was common scenery in most space colonies.
everyone in that artificial environment led a life suitable for the earth, the planet of humanity's origin.
a day was 24 hours, like on earth.
the sun rose when it became morning, and set when it became night.
in the daytime, clouds floated across the blue sky.
at night, the moon rose over the starry sky.
however, that was implemented by broadcasting a stereoscopic image on the manmade city's ceiling.
sometimes, they even made artificial rain fall, supposedly to reproduce the earth's environment.
everybody was notified of the rainfall schedule in advance, and acted in accordance with the weather forecasts, which were never off.
to speak of the biggest difference from the earth, the inorganic walls of the stronghold appeared in places all across the artificial sky.
but even they were merely a “natural” thing to the people who had been born and raised in the colony.
the cordelian 2nd army barracks.
established in a block close to cordelia's urban area, it was a barracks for land troops whose purpose was city defence.
the commander of the army corps was general alfred waters.
however, he was a mere figurehead.
in reality, he had the backing of the minister of state, baron basil charlois, who was known to the neo terras faction.
charlois was important to me, as i was secretly manoeuvring to assist the neo terras within cordelia and overthrow the current government.
i had come to the 2nd army barracks to meet charlois.
normally, i would never proceed to his location directly.
until now, we had erred on the side of caution, and held repeated meetings in secret.
the fact that i was a spy might have been discovered because of anything, no matter how trivial.
however, i couldn't even say something like that, since we had reached this emergency situation.

in our present circumstances, where my strategy had been forced to undergo a massive change thanks to kiria, i urgently needed to give the minister an explanation of the situation, and the change of plan.

name: dino
normalized: wasting too much time thanks to that dimwitted whore… shit!
i didn't even know how many times i had cursed anymore.
however, while on the one hand i was irritated by that stupid woman, i had had an indescribable bad feeling for a while.

name: dino
normalized: it's too quiet…
in spite of the appearance of the neo terran fleet, the inside of the barracks was silent.
it wasn't clear what was going on inside.
but i seemed to get goosebumps on the nape of my neck.
my intuition, which had gotten me through numerous life-or-death scrapes before, was giving off a warning to leave this place right away.
was it a mistake to come here directly, like i thought?

name: dino
normalized: shit…!
i was about to leave, when several cordelian soldiers appeared from behind cover and surrounded me.

name: dino
normalized: （tch…!
i've been ambushed?!
despite mentally clicking my tongue, i promptly covered over that with the “public” face i used on cordelia.
it was the face of the archbishop――the highest-ranking person in the church, who played a role that acknowledged him as the representative of god at times of grand ducal succession.
the role had been protected for generations, ever since the cordelian grand ducal family was on earth.

name: dino
normalized: what are you people?!
who do you think i am…?!

name: soldier
normalized: are you archbishop dino dilasso-sama?
despite saying so courteously, the soldiers were alertly pointing their guns at me.

name: dino
normalized: who instigated this outrage, knowing that i am the archbishop?!

name: alicia
normalized: i apologize for this rudeness, archbishop-sama.

name: dino
normalized: （what…?!
an unexpected figure had appeared.
a woman who wasn't supposed to be here.
it was alicia viewstroem, who should have been on the front line, facing against the approaching neo terran army.
she was also the person i least wanted to meet right now.

name: dino
normalized: （tch, this is likely to be a problem.
however, saying nothing at all about the surprise in my mind,

name: dino
normalized: oh, hello there, alicia-sama.
we meet at an unexpected place, i see.

name: alicia
normalized: what a coincidence.
i wonder what business the archbishop-sama has in a place like this?

name: dino
normalized: well now, alicia-sama is also saying something strange.
you're asking about my duty as a messenger of god at a time like this, in a place like this?

name: alicia
normalized: i have no such intention at all.
of course i am well aware of the archbishop-sama's duty.

name: dino
normalized: then that's all right… incidentally, alicia-sama, is this some kind of joke?
i said, looking over the soldiers, whose guns were still readied.

name: alicia
normalized: joke?
alicia feigned ignorance.

name: dino
normalized: i'm saying, make them put those away.
understand?

name: alicia
normalized: ku, kukuku.
alicia suddenly curved her arrogant face, and made an unpleasant laugh.

name: dino
normalized: what's so funny?
even if you are alicia-sama, this insolent behaviour towards me will――
despite maintaining my solemnity as the archbishop, i slightly roughened my voice, and alicia smiled as she interrupted me.

name: alicia
normalized: this certainly is a joke.
it's funny that the archbishop-sama is hanging around here to plot with my uncle, isn't it?

name: dino
normalized: （wha…?!
i couldn't help but shudder.
the “uncle” alicia spoke of was baron basil charlois, who i was about to meet.
he was the younger brother of alicia's father, count leif viewstroem, as well as the previous grand duke, gerd cordelia.
he had distanced himself from the cordelia family early on, and become the adopted child of the family of baron charlois.
therefore, he couldn't succeed the position of grand duke under cordelia's constitution, but he was seen by the nation as the grand duke's blood relative.
there were also powers who tried to support him and make him grand duke, and those powers had been planning to join hands with the neo terras and overthrow alicia.

in other words, my role was to influence cordelia as the archbishop, and act as a go-between for the neo terras and baron charlois's faction, and also, as the representative of god, to recognize the baron when he publicly succeeded the grand ducal throne.
without the approval of god, he would be unable to inherit the grand ducal throne.
that was clearly written in cordelia's constitution, and the archbishop was that important a figure to cordelia.
that was why i had adorned the mask of archbishop, and continued playing the part perfectly until now.
and yet…

name: dino
normalized: （does the fact that alicia took such hard-line measures at the very last moment mean that the plan was discovered after all?

name: dino
normalized: （shit, this is also the fault of that stupid woman, who can't think about anything but winning through combat!
it appeared that my unrest had ended up showing on my face.

name: alicia
normalized: archbishop dino dilasso-sama, huh?
hmph.
casting off her slight courtesy, alicia expressed fierce hatred in her eyes.

name: alicia
normalized: it appears that, three years ago, the previous archbishop-sama died, and you became archbishop, but… now.

name: alicia
normalized: are you a fake?
or are you the real archbishop, but a traitor to our cordelia?

name: dino
normalized: （what do i do?
no matter what, i can't take on this many people.

name: alicia
normalized: one way or the other, what we're going to do will be the same, though.

name: dino
normalized: （kuh, it can't be helped, huh…?

name: dino
normalized: alicia-sama, i don't know what's――

name: alicia
normalized: silence!

name: dino
normalized: guh!
a backhand blow from alicia mercilessly struck my jaw.
it was a considerably sharp blow for a woman, but i could grab onto her hand and counterattack.
however, deliberately without doing so, i collapsed on the spot as i was struck.

name: alicia
normalized: don't underestimate me, neo terran dog.
i will absolutely not allow anyone to get in the way of maya's enthronement.
whether they're the real archbishop, or oji-ue, my blood relative.

name: dino
normalized: guhah?!
this time, a kick to the solar plexus.

name: dino
normalized: （kuku, you can be conceited like that for now…）

name: alicia
normalized: hmph!
i don't like this.
you bastard, what are you hiding?
your eyes are not the eyes of someone who's been backed into a corner.

name: dino
normalized: （that's right, the one who's been cornered is you, bitch.
cordelia's onihime…）

name: dino
normalized: m… my name is… dino dilasso… divine punishment will fall upon you for doing something like this… alicia-sama…

name: alicia
normalized: still saying that, lowlife?!
gah!
leaving it to anger, alicia's kick broke several of my ribs.
while hearing the awful sound of that, i uncouthly fainted at the feet of the hot-blooded princess.

name: dino
normalized: （this pain and disgrace, i will pay you back 10 00-fold…）
i vowed inside my mind, as…

name: alicia
normalized: restrain this man.
i'll interrogate him directly afterwards.
alicia ordered her subordinates, looking down upon the archbishop―― or rather, the man who was referred to as such, who was rolling around and vomiting blood.

name: alicia
normalized: （what's with this man…?
alicia was never afraid on the battlefield, but an unpleasant sweat dampened her back.
dino dilasso's eyes made her feel nothing but physical revulsion, which she couldn't hold back through reason or bravery.
they were like a snake watching its venom slowly circulating through its prey and killing it.

name: alicia
normalized: （a man like this, sinking his poisoned fangs into me?
ridiculous.
with one shake of her head, she casually discarded the unpleasant thought that had come to mind.
then, alicia noticed a female officer appear from amongst the soldiers.

name: alicia
normalized: is this all right, commander-dono?

name: rieri
normalized: yes, alicia-sama.
the woman, who was clad in a space federation uniform, was commander rieri bishop.
being a high-level investigator belonging to the military police force investigation bureau, she was a heroic woman who had exposed many of the neo terras' injustices.
she was highly popular among the new solar citizens due to her talent and beautiful looks, and had been touted as the brains of the new solars.
alicia expressed a different smile to the one she made at maya, and

name: alicia
normalized: i've told you, rieri, “alicia” is fine.
i think of you as a friend before an envoy of the new solars.

name: rieri
normalized: thank you, alicia.
rieri sent back a smile that made alicia sense her beauty and boldness.
rieri bishop and alicia were old friends, who had gotten to know each other when alicia was studying abroad on titan.
maya had also been acquainted with her since she was very young, so she had a family-wide friendship with the cordelia house.

name: alicia
normalized: let's speak at leisure after i crush the neo terran fleet.
maya will also be happy when she knows that you've arrived.

name: rieri
normalized: maya-sama is going out on her first battle, huh?

name: alicia
normalized: yeah, it's annoying that she doesn't understand her position.

name: rieri
normalized: even if you say that, it's not convincing.

name: alicia
normalized: no doubt, hahaha!
the two heroines exchanged bold smiles.

name: rieri
normalized: good luck in the battle, alicia.

name: alicia
normalized: thank you, rieri.
alicia loudly spun around in her combat shoes.

name: alicia
normalized: now, prepare for the real departure.
